newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares quiet as brokers ride out year-end.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares quiet as brokers ride out year-end.

text.p: Leading Russian shares changed little on Wednesday as local brokers raced to close their year-end books and Western buyers stayed away, traders said.
The Russian Trading System of 24 shares edged down nearly 0.348 percent to 184.35 on $8.11 million in volume.

"Western participation in the market is seen less and less, and only Russian reshuffling remains," said Mikhail Khaleyev, chief trader at Alfa-Capital. "Current prices are unlikely to be seriously raised or pushed down."
Bobby Meshoyrer, director of sales and trading at IK Aton, said some share prices sank as regional brokers with old orders took fright at investors' unwillingness to buy.
He forecast a slow market until mid-January and then a strong rise later.

Samaraenergo rose to $0.34 from $0.30 at Monday's close when it was last traded, Rostelekom rose to $2.30 from $2.27 at Tuesday's close, Lenenergo fell to $0.350 from $0.387 and UES was $0.0829 after $0.0825.
